title: General Rule of Interpretation 1
text: The titles of sections, chapters and subchapters are provided for ease of reference only; for legal purposes, classification shall be determined according to the terms of the headings and any relative section or chapter notes.

title: General Rule of Interpretation 2
text: Any reference in a heading to an article shall be taken to include a reference to that article incomplete or unfinished, provided that, as presented, it has the essential character of the complete or finished article.

title: General Rule of Interpretation 3
text: When goods are, prima facie, classifiable under two or more headings, classification shall be effected as follows: mixtures, composite goods or goods put up in sets for retail sale shall be classified as if they consisted of the material or component which gives them their essential character.

title: General Rule of Interpretation 4
text: Goods which cannot be classified in accordance with the above rules shall be classified under the heading appropriate to the goods to which they are most akin.

title: General Rule of Interpretation 5
text: In addition to the foregoing provisions, the following rules shall apply: packing materials and packing containers presented with the goods are classified with the goods if of a kind normally used for packing such goods.

title: General Rule of Interpretation 6
text: For legal purposes, the classification of goods in the subheadings of a heading shall be determined according to the terms of those subheadings and any related subheading notes.
